data.title: I'm pretty sure this level of Filth is illegal.
data.text: For starters, the room stinks, big time. Smells like mold. The bathroom was so filthy that I didn't want to take a shower, let alone put my two-year-old in it. The walls, doors, and counters are covered with crud and there is dust on the baseboards. I'm going to have to go to the dollar store and clean this room myself because I can't deal with this for another day (left my home town for a hurricane evacuation and didn't have time to be picky), to top it off, this is no 'best value.' They charged me $144 for a disgusting room that I have to clean myself. This needs to be remodeled. The lampshades are torn and the bathroom has numerous cracks. The carpet hasn't seen a vacuum cleaner in a while. Basically, nothing good about this room at all. Skip this one. Keep traveling west if there is nothing else in WR. If there is any possible way I can home tomorrow, I Will do so and cut my losses.

data.title: WARNING DO NOT STAY HERE!!!!!
data.text: During the evacuation we went here for a room , the staff were rude, there was blood on the sink with green mold on the wash cloth and, doodo stains every where looks like a war. please do not stay here. urine on the bed ans so much nasty stuff stay away people.....

data.title: Not good, even for evacuees.
data.text:
The current evacuation of all SC coastal areas in fear
of Hurricane Matthew has been a boon for hotels more inland.  We planned to leave our home on Hilton Head Island for Augusta , GA, but all hotels taking pets were full, so we went further, to Macon, GA.
This was the only reservation we could get.
We could have driven to Atlanta, but we were tired, after a 5 hour, stressful, drive from the lowcountry, so we stayed the first night of a reserved stay of 3.

Well...let me tell you:  the cat loved the room.  He enjoyed batting around the dirty Kleenex which he found on the floor by the bed with the beer tab and candy wrapper.  2 lamps had no bulbs, the curtain rod wouldn't let us open the curtains, 2 lamps lacked shades, there were bugs (dead) in the bureau, one of the bureau drawers was falling off, and there is no way I would use the bathtub. Also, the carpet was so bad, we should have used shoes.  The "non-smoking" room had ashes on a chair and cigarette burns on everything.

After spending  hours online last nite, we were able to book another hotel for the last 2 nites.  Ordinarily we would stay, not wanting the hassle of moving, but this was too much.  Oh, yes, no coffee in the lobby in am.  No food, either, tho my husband said he wouldn't eat it anyway.

Good stuff about the hotel:  free Macon newspaper; cable tv which worked; let us check in early; refunded two nites without a hassle; and let us have an hour late checkout. 

Other cons:  owner(?) didn't have good English skills and didn't seem to understand the computer.  Check in took a very long time.  But, he was pleasant.

data.title: RM 115 Just plan Fifthy
data.text: RM 115 Nasty Nasty Nasty. Asked for clean pillow case attendant said he don't have any and don't know what to do. Pull covers bk to examine 2nd bed it was even more nasty. These people are not cleaning these rooms nor beds. Don't go here unless u plan to take something home u don't want.

data.title: Disgusting!
data.text: OMG!!!! Never stay here! The rooms are awful and they stink! The floors are uneven! The bathroom looked as if someone went mudding! Lightbulbs were out! The door did not lock properly!  The lady at the counter was completely unprofessional in a stripper type manner!! I can not believe this establishment is even operating!

data.title: Never Again ~
data.text: Front area felt bare & attendant spoke such bad English I could hardly understand him. Then, to top it off, we waited about 20 min while he fumbled my email receipt around, trying to find my reservation, which I made directly thru AmBestValueInn over a month before. No explanation from him...just fumbling. Finally got us a room...kinda wish he hadn't. Outside our room there was trash & cigarette butts on the grass.Room was dingy, trash behind doors, only 1/2 roll of TP (not even on the roller), 1 small packet of shampoo for a double room, no tissues & it just goes on. The most disturbing was the group of 6 - 8 young men hanging out in the parking lot. Their jinxed out cars were not in room parking but beside a blank brick wall next to our room wing. As we were 2 women staying alone we did not leave to go get dinner but stayed locked in our room. Don't stay here..good price or not.

data.title: Horrible
data.text: As you walk in the lobby you get an strange feeling. Then there is a man that speaks very bad English. The rooms were terrible. We had two rooms and the smell was terrible. The furniture was almost broken, there was mould on the airconditioning and the toilet, no words for it. We stayed there for 15 min and booked an other hotel. One positive thing, we got our money back.

data.title: Not even a roll of toilet paper, dirty sheets, nasty.
data.text:
Though I was in an emergent situation and the price was right, the room was the worst ever. The sheets were dirty, blood spots, not washed ones either, food, cigarette butts, and hair were on the sheets. The floor behind the door had food, a shower head, and more cigarette butts. The bathroom... Pee still in the toilet, no toilet paper, dirty towels. The shower water control didn't work right, the shower head was so low I had to squat to rinse my hair and I am only 5 ft 5 in tall. Dresser falling apart, ashes all over the nightstand.  The phone didn't work.
The tv worked though. 
I had to have something cheap, quick, and pet friendly, it fit the bill. Unfortunately it was so disgusting I should have paid a little more and gone down the road.

data.title: Not a place for good night sleep
data.text:
The lobby was a disaster, the guy that checked me in made me feel very weary when he hid behind a door for a moment with my debit card.

Once at my room it got worse. As I walked in the smell of air freshener was unbearable, the sheets were dirty and the bathroom just as scary. Thank goodness it was only one night and I showered before leaving home. I slept fully dressed on top of the comforter and could never get the room a pleasant temperature, the heater wouldn't function until it had blown cold air for over an hour at which time the heat overtook the room making unpleasant in the opposite manner.

If you can't afford something better, pack a sleeping bag suited to the season, a pillow or two, your own towel if you absolutely have to shower there along with any personal hygiene items such as shampoo and soap or body wash.

data.title: This was an excellent stay and a great bargain.
data.text: The rooms are very clean, and the grounds well kept.  The front desk people are very pleasant and cheerful.  Check in is quick and easy.  This is the best deal on a good hotel I've found in a long time, and I travel often.  I will always come  here when I'm in Warner Robins, and I might even stay here when I have business in Macon.  Probably worth the drive for the savings.

data.title: Even worse than I had expected...
data.text: The room was old and shabby, the beds were worn out long before I was born, and mysterious stains were on the walls. The heater/AC unit was literally falling apart and the door was difficult to lock having been kicked in before apparently. Im guessing this place has a long history of crime scene tape decorations. There was a set of projects next door that attracted the usual "pleasant" crowd, many of whom were attending a loud rap music birthday in the hotels meeting room. When I complained to the night mgr he said they would only go until midnight! This was at 9pm. Earplugs dont help when its booming bass noise. The wireless internet is useless, I barely got online by picking up wireless from a nearby hospital and a Pizza Hut. I'd go back to the tents I lived in over in Iraq and Afghanistan before I ever came back here.

owner_response.author: abvicartersville, Owner at Americas Best Value Inn Warner Robins, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Dear Traveler,
  
Your feedback is very important to us and we appreciate the fact that you took the time to let us know that your stay was not up to your expectations.  We apologize for this and will certainly look into our comments and take any appropriate action.  It is our goal to provide all of our guests with quality service and comfort at an exceptional price.

If you had let us know about the A/C, we could have moved you to another room.  We do have guests who rent the banquet rooms and since your complaint, we have stopped all music at midnight, which is also the time our internet service stops.

We hope you will give us another chance to show you we do take complaints seriously.

Sincerely,
Management
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Disgusting!!!!!!  Horrible Experience!!!
data.text: I stayed there 24-26 Apr 09.  As soon as I walked in a terrible odor slapped me in the face.  The humidity in the room made us feel like we were in a steam room (Not hot but wet!!).  I was there to spend the weekend with my two small children.  I did not even allow them to shower there....they showered at a family members home.  The sheets were stained and had cigarette burns in the pillow cases.  The room was not properly cleaned and I am sorry to say it was totally disgusting!!!  Found out that after 15minutes after check in they would not allow you a refund on the room.  I will never stay there again and I will never recommend it to anyone.  This hotel makes all the other ABV hotels look bad.  ABV has lost my business for life!!

data.title: Terrible experience!!!
data.text: My daughters (both toddlers) and I reserved three nights at this hotel on line from FL.  My experience at this hotel was one of the worst experiences I've had at a hotel if not the worst experience.  Entering the room there was an awful smell the sheets on both beds were stained it appeared they were not washed from the previous guest, the bathroom......well I posted pictures please feel free to view them.  I went back to the office to express my concerns about the room the lady not very moved with how I felt said there was nothing she could do for me and she could not change my sheets or towels because that was handled by an outside cleaning crew.  Unfortunately I was forced to stay there that night being that it was too late and I did not know my way around the area, but first thing the next morning we were out of the hotel.

data.title: Perfect Location
data.text: This is a very clean and well kept hotel. It is right by the base. Our stay was pleasant. Thank you!
